content: To the Chief Musician; in a mournful strain. A skillful song,  didactic  reflective poem of David.
They are corrupt  evil, and have committed repulsive injustice;
There is no one who does good.
God has looked down from heaven upon the children of men
To see if there is anyone who understands,
Who seeks after God [who requires Him, who longs for Him as essential to life].
Every one of them has turned aside  fallen away;
Together they have become filthy  corrupt;
There is no one who does good, no, not even one.
